Reviews.Title: “Very chic hotel with good view from balcony!”
Reviews.Author: BinDereDoneDat
Reviews.Content: I usually stay around the Villa Borgese, but as previous hotel was full I tried this one. It's really nice with very modern colours in the lobby and in the room, especially the bathroom. There was a small balcony with a table and chair outside my room overlooking a small park opposite, which looked great., I got the Airport Shuttle into the hotel from Da Vinci Airport for €21, and back again fro €20. Benefit over the train was that the shuttle dropped you direct to your hotel. Train would have cost €14 +€2commission, and then a taxi fro unknown price. However hotel is within 2km from Termini, so could have walked provided you knew the way and didn't get lost. I walked in Rome which is easy to do from this location, although you could use the metro to get to places further away. A nice walk is through the Villa Borgese gardens, and then to the art gallery and Etruscan museum on the far side. Also went to Harry's Bar on Via Veneto for a beer - worthwhile for one just so you've been there , but at €11 it's expensive - however they also have bar food snacks which in fairness are free.

Reviews.Title: “A real 4 star Hotel”
Reviews.Author: FrequentTraveller666
Reviews.Content: A real 4 star hotel. Nice and neat rooms. Polite staff (except the restaurant lady at the breakfast time that stares at you all the time) nice breakfast though. Internet price is too high and speed is too low! A bit far from Metro but still OK. Bed mattresses are a bit old but I had no fuss. I had a good sleep. Smooth check-in and check-out. Lobby is very nice and pretty impressive!

Reviews.Title: “Better than some in Rome”
Reviews.Author: Italychaperone
Reviews.Content: We spent two nights in this hotel as part of a school tour. My friend and her husband shared a room on the top floor, that had a lovely bathroom and a sitting area and an amazing view. However, her electricity went out on two occasions. Some of our rooms were not cleaned or given fresh towels. My room was essentially clean (bathroom spotless), but it could have used a good dusting. It had a spacious lobby. You had to purchase the Wi-Fi. The location was good. Breakfast was ok. You do have to request real coffee, if you don't care for the instant which is in the urns. We requested cappuccini or caffe doppio each morning and it was never a problem. Beds were comfortable with very crisp linens. Pillows a bit flat.

Reviews.Title: “Modern design but cold and unwelcoming”
Reviews.Author: Mosaferan
Reviews.Content: When we arrived the guy at reception did not even raise his head to notice or welcome us, he then checked us in in a very cold and unfriendly manner! The room was clean, however hotel's utility room was next door and staff were very loud and inconsiderate, banging the doors and moving the trolies. We asked for a different room and they said they cant relocate us but instead can give us 2hrs free wireless internet!!!! The hotel had cut off all heating and the rooms were very cold. We asked if they could put on the heating for our room and their response was "sorry, use the exta blankets"! We will not be booking this hotel again!

Reviews.Title: “A successful choice”
Reviews.Author: nanoukaki
Reviews.Content: Beautiful , clean rooms, nice breakfast buffet with very friendly staff. Quiet location but not far from city centre!

Reviews.Title: “nor special nor disastrous”
Reviews.Author: costinul_ala
Reviews.Content: The hotel is close to the central railway station and connected with the city center. The salaria street passes just behind the hotel and there you can find 4 buses for termini and another one that takes through via Veneto, via del Corso all the way to Testacio. It is in a very good neighborhood with good restaurants. The hotel it self offers a good breakfast compared to others in the area, however the rooms are not pretty (a chromatic disaster to be precise) and not the cleanest either. When I stayed there (april 2011) the internet was available for 5 euros per 2 hours .... so nothing has changes since 1998 in this aspect ...

Reviews.Title: “Off the beaten tourist track”
Reviews.Author: PrincePolo
Reviews.Content: The hotel is off the beaten tourist track but with good public transport connections (buses) to the central train station. A taxi to/from the airport (Fiumicino) takes over an hour, if there is no traffic. I had a meeting nearby, so the location was perfect for me. There are some nice restaurants nearby. My room was spacious and adequately decorated for the hotel class. Breakfast was satisfactory although nothing to write home about. It was an uneventful stay in an uneventful hotel. I would probably stay there again if I am in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Mostly disinterested staff, dubious food. Rooms OK though!”
Reviews.Author: 20tc
Reviews.Content: The hotel appears nice on arrival with good reception and bar area. Rooms are up to spec with good sized beds, cupboards, etc. and in good, clean condition. But what lets the place down is the disinterested staff who seem annoyed that people are staying there and asking for coffee and other bar drinks. Considering we were a large group of people on company expenses you would have though they would have seen the cash-register coming. Instead we received, at best, average service and ended up in the few bars near to the hotel, one of which was pretty expensive and recommended by the staff.... Breakfast was 'ok' but lunch meals taken during the conference was poor at best. You kind of believe the Roman's would be good at Italian food.... So if you get a good rate and are out of the hotel much of the time, it would be fine.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Mariana_Vale
Reviews.Content: Great hotel! Just a few minutes to Termini, on bus. Not very close to city center.

Reviews.Title: “Beware First time Rome tourist : Hotel is in the Middle of Nowhere”
Reviews.Author: YoungCouple1111
Reviews.Content: Our travel agency booked this "good value" hotel in Rome. The hotel is the middle of nowhere. This hotel is ideal for group tourist since they have their own transportation. There is no metro station nearby and you have to walk awhile to the bus stop . Unless you are an Italian, do not think it is "easy" to ride the bus. We took the bus 3 times and we always missed the stop on our way home..... it's not easy to remember landmarks in a historical city coz all the buildings looks the same (they have to conform with the city planning architectural code). Similarly the bus route going towards and out the city is different. Getting lost in the outskirts of historical Rome is not Priceless...it is scary!!!! Get "lost" in the nice part of Rome like the Vatican, Spanish step or the Trevi fountain area. Get a hotel near a Metro stop. Look at the google map and you'll find out Hotel Albani is the only hotel in its area (wonder why no other hotel owners would put one nearby?)

Reviews.Title: “*shrugs shoulders*”
Reviews.Author: RalphMilne
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for three nights in December. The rooms were free for us so I can't say how I'd have felt if I'd paid for them. That aside, some comments: avoid the first floor. The street can be noisy. If you're very unlucky (we were) you'll be directly above the hotel's load-in area and, before dawn, you'll be woken by the comings and goings of the staff, and whatever objects they were rolling in and out. We asked to move on the second morning and were lucky enough to be able to swap with a friend who was leaving. We got his 5th floor double room, overlooking the courtyard (you'd be well advised to ask for a room overlooking the courtyard, just in case you get the noisy street side). Much better. The decor were decent, the beds were decent, the breakfast was oaky. It was all a bit average. The bar could be pretty nice if they dimmed the lights, turned off the TVs, played something other than ropey Euro-pop, and if the barman would hand out a smile now and again. The staff, in fact, are what let the hotel down. In three days we were smiled at by two of them, out of maybe twenty. There just wasn't any warmth, and you can live with cold staff if the hotel is impressive in other ways, but it isn't. It doesn't have any pretensions to be a high-class joint, but it would do well to raise its standards overall.

Reviews.Title: “AWFUL!”
Reviews.Author: CHRIS554
Reviews.Content: Dont go!Our room had a disgusting smell from the bathroom,the heat of the room was adjusted centrally, and it was so hot that we woke in the middle of the night,dripping in sweat.The breakfast was equally awful,in a hall on the basement,consisting 70% of tasteless sweets,burned bacon,plastic omellette made of egg powder,sour juice,green tomatoes(they were not ripe yet),one basket with some slices of bread,and all this for 144 euros per night!!!In the morning we went by bus to the termini easily,but at night we had to wait for the bus at the termini for half an hour.If you wish to travel to rome,book a hotel in the area of the termini,where you are next to the trains,you can eat something any time,after your tours you return to your hotel easily to rest .

Reviews.Title: “Vacation Starts Here”
Reviews.Author: baysil
Reviews.Content: Our 10 day packaged tour of Italy was scheduled to begin with 2 nights at the Albani Hotel. We booked 1 night before the tour, to settle in - getting a great rate through EasyJet with our flight from London to Rome. The tour operator changed the Rome hotel, but we decided to enjoy our bargain night in this lovely hotel. It is in a quiet neighborhood, north of many tourist attractions: we were introduced to the Rome of neighborhoods and welcoming people. The staff was professional and helpful and recommended an excellent local restaurant. Our room was not large, but comfortable and beautifully and whimsically styled in bright colors. The buffet breakfast was substantial, and clearly 'laid on' for tourists, as Italians start their days with a small coffee and a sweet roll. Note to American travelers - bring washcloths, as Europeans use lovely linen towels for 'personal' use. After a restful and welcoming night at the Albani, we were ready to begin our tour.

Reviews.Title: “Typical Italian chaos but nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: inuit66
Reviews.Content: Had to wait 2 hours in the lobby before the room was ready, and every time I had to use the service of the reception 3 very well dressed gentlemen argued in 20 minutes on how to solve what always seemed to be a problem to them. Nice and spacey room though. A bit far walk to town center.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing...with one exception.”
Reviews.Author: Matthew R
Reviews.Content: I traveled to Rome for the first time for a Spring Break Trip with some friends. When we arrived, we were warmly greeted by the staff (who's english was pretty well). The lobby was fantastic and beautiful. The bar and lounge area right off the lobby were great. It was a good place to wind down each night after a long day of sight seeing. I only have one complaint. My room was TINY - even my European standards. I understand it was a single room, but I could literally stretch my arms from one wall to the other. I know that I was in there by myself, but I wish it would have been larger. Another thing I found wrong was the view. I did not have one. It was of a alley. Overall, however, the stay was fantastic. The breakfast was delicious (and the room was very large) and the staff was friendly. I just wish it had been a little closer to the main attractions however. It was a good 30 minute ride (with traffic) to get to most places.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, quiet location”
Reviews.Author: ExistingAlternatives
Reviews.Content: Our room was 229 in the new addition remodelled with modern metal-on-wood colour scheme (which will eventually replace pink/purple scheme elsewhere). Our bathroom was all done in red. The headboard was a large back-lit image of a waterfall. Room was small, but its weird shape made it feel like a suite with a separate foyer. “Double” bed was actually queen size. Reception staff, seeing us traveling with a toddler, insisted (!) that double bed will be better than two twins for us, which turned out to be true. Chambermaids, when realized that we have a baby, left us an extra towel without any request. Many rooms have balconies - ours had a small window with very elaborate internal and external shutters. It overlooked villa Albani. Water pressure was good, although water temperature varied dramatically, especially in the morning. Access to our room had very narrow corridors, with some stairs. The location of the hotel is very interesting – while it is away from touristy bustle, it is very accessible by bus or on foot. If you travel by bus from terminal (buses 86, 92, 217, 360), keep in mind that some streets are one-way and the stop for the hotel could be a little hard to find (most buses will stop at Via Po and Via Ofanto). Going to terminal / downtown, the bus stop is right on Via Salaria. You buy tickets or buses at tobacco shops, which are everywhere and marked by large “T” above entrance. Easiest (if not closest) subway stop to reach is Termini. That said, the walk between hotel and terminal is not too bad either (~20 minutes with luggage and stroller): from terminal you’d need to turn right on Via Battaglia, at p.za Indipindenza turn left on Goito and stay on it while it turns into Piave and then Salaria, after a large park turn right onto Ada. Breakfast very pleasant, albeit limited and repetitive (small menu available for extra options). Food in the bar was good – prices in line with downtown fare. If you prefer buying your own groceries, there is Docs right around the corner (Via Isonzo and Tevere). There was no tea/coffee set in the room, but full mini-bar (fee). The crowd was a mix of business people and bus tours. Wi-fi is pre-paid everywhere, although there was no signal in our room.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely stay!”
Reviews.Author: Cheshire_cat86
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel from 9th-11th October. The hotel is a short bus ride from Termini via bus 86, 92 or 910. The hotel is via close to Villa Borghese and easy to get to Trevi to see the Trevi fountain or Spanish steps! Lovely restaurant across the road and a lovely pastry shop around the corner. The staff were wonderful from the desk staff organising a taxi to the airport and providing advice on travel around Rome. Although u do need to travel to Termini to get to some locations, you escape the disturbance around the city centre for relaxation! The hotel provide towels and clean the room plus you see a friendly face on the front desk! One last thing, I really appreciate the hotel looking after my suitcase while exploring the city centre after check out as I had an evening flight!

Reviews.Title: “Not too bad”
Reviews.Author: Chris G
Reviews.Content: Stayed here from 2nd to 6th October. Positives are that we stayed in a street facing room which was very quiet and a nice view over to the trees in the park, the breakfast was superb, the room was very clean and spacious and the area as a whole is a nice walk (albeit very long) to the centre of Rome, easily reachable though if you have a bus pass. Now to the negatives, I must say that the breakfast and bar staff and the female staff were very friendly and helpful. The same cannot be said for the male staff albeit for one, especially the middle aged gentlemen. Any question asked to them was treated as if it was a chore with a a roll of the eyes and a groan. One even could not communicate with us after observing him speaking in English prior to another couple!!! On checkout the demand for Rome tax was treated with a click of the fingers and the receipt tossed across the desk at us, not even a 'hope you enjoyed your stay' before disappearing into the back. If you don't like dealing with tourists, why work in a hotel? Apart from this it was an agreeable stay.

Reviews.Title: “Would stay here again”
Reviews.Author: ACTH_CA
Reviews.Content: We love the space and it's clean. Concierge was very helpful with our travelling plans and direction. It's a 10 minute bus ride to the tourist area (Pantheon, Trevi, Colosseum, etc), 1 euro each way. Bus stop is right around the corner. We did that everyday during our stay. The bus runs every 15 mins or less. It's also about 10 minute bus ride from the termini. I like the location. It's quiet away from the tourist area - perfect after a long day out and about - for a very good night sleep. If you are going to the vatican, there is a trolley 5 mins walk away from the hotel that takes you there. Bonus - the little restaurant on the same street has so much to offer. Their pasta is amazing and great price (about 8 euro) and lunch time is packed with local business execs. I wanted to go back the second time but they only take cash. Seriously, best pasta and amazing service (we tried various places , high end and low end, their pasta is just unbeatable, rustic, simple and just delish). Menu is in italian but they are extremely helpful providing recommendation and translation. The gnocchi looks good too.

Reviews.Title: “Awful customer service”
Reviews.Author: Nadia A
Reviews.Content: Unless you are visiting Rome for business, my husband and I would not recommend staying at this hotel. It is far from most tourist attractions (except Villa Borghese) and Roma Termini. The people in the reception area were not hospitable at all. They treated us like we were an inconvenience to them (the males ones especially). No smiles, almost reluctant to help and answer our inquiries. Their room and breakfast were average, nothing special. If you don't mind the poor customer service at the concierge, then by all means pick this hotel. If not, please avoid at all costs.

Reviews.Title: “Albani Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ChestnutPA
Reviews.Content: In September, as part of a tour, we spent two nights at the Albani Hotel. The location is more residential so it’s a bit of a hike to get to any of the main attractions but the hotel does supply maps at the desk and after an eight hour flight and six hour time difference walking felt very good. The lobby made a very positive impression and the circular staircase running between floors was well lit and well kept. Our room was very nice and clean and more spacious than I anticipated for a European hotel room. We actually had a bedroom, dressing room and very modern, large bath. For September Rome was still pretty hot—temperatures were in the high 80’s. The only air conditioning unit in the room was in the bedroom area so the dressing room and bathroom did get very warm. We had to run the air conditioning continuously during our stay to try to keep the area cool. My husband very kindly didn’t inform me until after we had checked out that when he looked down into the air conditioning unit he could see mold. Our tour included a buffet breakfast which was served promptly at 6:30 a.m. (and not a minute sooner). The eggs, which one person suggested were powdered, weren’t very edible but they did have a wide variety of other options. All in all we had a very good stay at the Albani.

Reviews.Title: “Cute, colorful and cozy hotel in Rome!”
Reviews.Author: Adimanusask
Reviews.Content: Albani Hotel is a nice and very pleasant hotel in Rome. Location is very good: walking distance to the main attractions and archeological sites, quiet area. The staff was very helpful and kind, room service amazing! I will definitely go there again!

Reviews.Title: “Nice and quiet hotel”
Reviews.Author: YiannisIoannou
Reviews.Content: Good hotel, not near the center. You can go by bus 63 and 630 from near the hotel.Good breakfast but in a small room. Rooms are nice.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: lo_sug
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at this hotel in July for 6 nights. I would defiantly recommend this hotel to anyone. Although it is not at a central point in Rome we found it easy enough to get around. We bought a bus pass for 16 euros and that was for use of all the buses for the whole week so it was really useful. Buses pass frequently to all the main tourist areas and the majority of the buses go to the main station Termani. The hotel its self was immaculate. We were really impressed with our double room with a balcony overlooking the park. The TV worked with Italian and English channels and the beds were really comfortable. The bathroom was really pretty and very clean and the shower worked perfectly. The room was cleaned daily and the staff were really friendly. We had a buffet breakfast which was plentiful to start your day and we also ate in the bar on the day of our arrival and the food was lovely. The only thing I would advise is that when you are checking out of your room the hotel charges a 3 euro per person per night charge for City Tax, we were unaware of this so it is a really good job we had a little bit of cash left at the end of our stay. But all in all we had a really enjoyable holiday and I would defiantly stay at this hotel again. :) xox

Reviews.Title: “god location and nice serving”
Reviews.Author: ririnuk
Reviews.Content: Good service - they were very understanding and allowed my mother to check-in sooner than their check-in hour, which I really appreciate. Also, good service at breakfast in the morning. The room was spacious, very clean and well organised. I also loved the bathroom - big and a lot of space for my beauty stuff :) They came and change the towels daily. What I did not like were the thin walls... and the jetlagged Americans that talked laud all night long...

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Stream_Lines
Reviews.Content: Visited this hotel with my gf and we liked this hotel. Our room and bathroom were modern, clean and nicely decorated. Reception is modern and staff helpful. Breakfast is a buffet and food is varied and abundant. The only downside of this hotel is it's location as it is not right in the heart of Rome although buses pass frequently from next to the hotel to the centre. Of this does not bother you than I would definetely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Zero for hospitality”
Reviews.Author: Tarentaal
Reviews.Content: This hotel was fine, allthough more of a conference hotel. Unfortunately one incident changed our stay into an unpleasant experience. After reception told us that breakfast will be until 10h30, we walked in at about two minutes before 10. One of the male staff members walked in and started shouting at us. Afterwards he went back into the kitchen and then started shouting at the staff at the back. He came back and again started shouting at us, after which my husband told him that we were guests and he should behave himself. I did complain to the reception and asked them to get hold of the mananger, which did not happen. Other staff members were friendly and did apologize for their colleague's behaviour.

Reviews.Title: “FANTASTIC HOTEL - AC ACTUALLY WORKED VERY COMFY”
Reviews.Author: slinky58
Reviews.Content: This was part of a Globus Tour - Excellent Hotel - the AC actually worked! Very comfy bed & pillows. Breakfast was execellent. I loved it.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable stay”
Reviews.Author: guille857
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel, good location-- a few minutes walk from the Palazzo Borghese and reasonably close to major sites. A safe, quiet neighborhood, not touristy. Very clean, comfortable rooms with good air conditioning and a normal sized bathroom. The staff were friendly and helpful and the breakfast was very good. As mentioned in other posts, the color schemes are a bit unusual but don't detract from the overall experience. I would stay here again in future visits.

Reviews.Title: “Clean hotel, calm neighbourhood and easy transport”
Reviews.Author: DizzyD5
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 3 days of business/leisure in Rome and were very pleased. The hotel is in a quiet residential neighbourhood away from the throngs of tourists, but within walking distance of the city centre (20 mins) or 5 min bus ride. Great small pasta restaurant next door, good shopping in the area, and across from the tranquil Villa Borghese gardens. Clean, modern room and good breakfast buffet included in the rate. Paying extra for wifi was a little annoying, but the service was good from the room. Also, the room was spacious and bright with lots of closet space but no drawers!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, uniqe breakfast service”
Reviews.Author: LynnaBudapest
Reviews.Content: We spent here 6 days. If you have chance, book a superior room/suite (we just saw one, but it was impressive) The hotel is ok, clean, helpful staff, internet was not available in our room (but they have many rooms, and we could use at reception). The mattress was not the best (overused - not flat everywhere) but we could sleep.

Reviews.Title: “A funky, comfortable hotel in a quiet area”
Reviews.Author: Bri77_uk
Reviews.Content: The first thing that strikes you in the Hotel Albani is the colour scheme - the lobby area and bar have some very funky sofas and chairs, and this theme is continued into the rooms. The staff I encountered were all very friendly and helpful and the general standard of service was excellent. I stayed in a standard double room, which was spacious, clean and very comfortable with a king size bed and flat screen tv - The colour scheme is a little on the 'kindergarten' side but it makes the hotel stand out in the memory and makes it feel quite fun. The only downside I could see was the distance from the major sites, although it is on several direct bus routes to Termini which take around 10 minutes. I took a taxi from Termini when I first arrived (brace yourself for a rollercoaster journey if you've never taken a taxi in Rome before!) which was a reasonable 11 Euros. That said, it is in a quiet area and is a five minute walk from the park at Villa Borghese, which is a great place to take a relaxing stroll. I would definitely stay here again when next in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel for a fair price”
Reviews.Author: lukkucairi32
Reviews.Content: Closer to the Villa Borgese, a few bus stops from Termini - Hotel is nice and clean. Our room was rather big but had a strange ceilling reaching down to 1.2 meters in the middle of the room at some points. The buffet breakfast was one of the best i've ever had in Italy! Bed was good, quiet location - so a good night sleep is guaranteed! You've got to like pink to survive the bathroom though! ;-)

Reviews.Title: “Holy Austin Powers Mod 60's Explosion!”
Reviews.Author: DPT1
Reviews.Content: We were booked at the Duke Hotel for our overnight before departing Italy; however, upon our arrival there, we were informed that they had make a mistake with our booking and the hotel was full, for U2 concertgoers (which explains the heavy police presence in the area - I was a tad concerned before our arrival!). We were sent to a sister property, the Albani. The place appears to have been recently renovated, but in an almost hilariously retro style that put me into the best of moods after the mix-up. The lobby area has low ceilings with glossy mod furniture. The room keys are inexplicable; you just have to see them to believe them. The rooms - the rooms! Lime green plush carpet; I mean Lime-Ade, neon. The bathroom is a Mondriani primary-colored mosaic fantasy. That being said, everything is extremely clean, new, and comfortable, although the towels seem more like dinner napkins. I can't believe that I didn't take any pictures. Since this was merely a place to rest for the night, I cannot comment on its proximity to (or distance from) sights of interest for tourists. We were pointed to Il Viaggio for a late dinner, and happened to get lost on the way. The surrounding neighborhood seemed to have some nice trattorias close by, and the Borghese is not far.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel near Borghese Gardens.”
Reviews.Author: Pukek0
Reviews.Content: A family owned hotel in Art deco Style. Our room was not large but well appointed, comfy bed and excellent bathroom. Window looked at back of other buildings, not pretty. Breakfast very good and plenty of food. This was in a residential area with restaurants nearby. A short walk to the Galleria Borghese. But it is quite a way from central Rome. Need to take a bus or taxi.

Reviews.Title: “Bright modern rooms, good value for money”
Reviews.Author: Ozzieozoz
Reviews.Content: Have just returned from a week in Rome staying at this hotel. Although I've been to Rome before, the two friends I was travelling with had not, and having read the reviews I was worried that the hotel might be too far away from the centre. In fact, we couldn't have chosen a better hotel. The Albani is ideally situated, it's only a few blocks away from the Borghese and there are good bus links into the centre of Rome. The 63, 630 routes take you to all the main tourist sights, and the No 19 tram (all of which are just at the end of the street) takes you direct to St Peters and the Vatican. You can walk to Via Veneto in about 20 minutes,but the bus and tram routes are frequent and fast. Actually, after spending the whole day surrounded by tourists in busy noisy Rome it was really good to get out of the centre and sample a bit of real Rome. There are several restaurants dotted here and there within a short distance from the hotel, and apart from a smattering of tourists, they mainly cater for locals. It was great to be in a quieter area mixing with locals, rather than have to fight for a table at a central restaurant. If you want to head into the centre, bus, tram and taxis are cheap. If you only have two or three days in Rome then you might want to choose a hotel right in the centre, but if you have longer, this hotel is a good choice and gives the best of both worlds. The Albani has a range of different rooms, from the standard double to the suites. We stayed in a super quad room on the 5th floor, which was spacious enough for three adults and also had a balcony. We found the staff helpful and polite, and had none of the problems reported in other reviews. They helped us book tours, book tables, taxis and so on. I'd definately stay in this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “ok for starting to explore rome”
Reviews.Author: LachniFranz
Reviews.Content: The hotel is quite nice,not very far from centre neither very close but we didn`t mind that,we used metro and busses and once walked to Colloseo and had fun time.Rooms are ok,clean and toilet(at least in our room) was spacious and breakfast was ok,standard for this type of hotels.Would recommend,due to the price which i think was appropriate.

Reviews.Title: “Great room. Location......wel??”
Reviews.Author: MMSIBOB
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for three nights at the end of July. The room was fantastic. Very modern and very clean. The bathroom was big as well. The hotel staff was very helpful when we asked for directions. The breafast was out of this world. Typical European fare as well as assorted cereals and scrambled eggs and bacon. The coffee was awesome. The real treat was they would make cappucino if requested. I'm not talking about cheap fast food type cappucino here. It was the real deal. The only problem I would have with staying here again was the location. Too far to walk to any popular sights. Even too far to walk to a metro station. The Termini was walkable but I doubt you would enjoy the walk with luggage. There is a bus stop very near and we ended up taking the #63 bus to the city center and metro. That worked out but it still would have been nice to come back to the room during the day to freshen up without losing too much time.

Reviews.Title: “Far Away from Major Attractions”
Reviews.Author: OrgulloMexicano
Reviews.Content: We were extremely disappointed with this hotel's location. We like to walk quite a bit, but this hotel was entirely too far to walk from the Vatican and the Colosseum. Even to get to the Piazza Navona it was about a 25 minute walk. The good news is that taxis are relatively cheap in Rome, and it only costs about 10 Euros to get anywhere in the city (make sure that you watch the meter and repeat the amount to the driver before he tries to tell you a different one). The other drawback was that the staff at the front desk was poor in general. They refused to help us call the airport shuttle, which would cost 31 euros for two people. This was probably because they wanted us to take their car service at a 50 euro cost to us. They also did not help us find any local restaurants. They only recommended this really expensive place when we later found out that there were cheaper and better places not too far away. The restaurants nearby (to the North, not the South) are pretty good, but other than that, we were disappointed with this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good Hotel- little bit far out of the centre”
Reviews.Author: JobellsYork
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed here in April for 3 nights for a weekend break. It's a very modern business hotel but offers great rates at weekends for tourists. Our room was very large with a huge (comfy) bed, a large balcony with sun loungers and table and chairs. A nice if rather garish yellow bathroom with quality toiletries. The only criticism of the bathroom was the lack of an extractor fan which meant it all got a bit steamy. Breakfast included in the price was very good with a whole range of pastries, breads, cold meats and cheeses, fruit and yoghurts as well as hot items, certainly enough to set us up for the day's sightseeing. The hotel is quite a way out of the centre of Rome( 20 minute walk to Termini) but there are regular bus routes to all the sights nearby which cost 1 euro per journey and also a tram line which goes directly to the Vatican. There are several local restaurants around the hotel and we ate at La Simeta on Via Simeta which did great pizzas in a wood fired oven for 7/8 euros. All in all a good hotel and if you're looking for somewhere to stay away from the hustle and bustle then it's a great hotel! The hotel charged 5 euros for 2 hours internet access which seemed a bit steep but otherwise it was good value.

Reviews.Title: “A perfect city break”
Reviews.Author: johnbuchan
Reviews.Content: A very good city centre hotel. Nice large room on the fifth floor; rooms on the fifth floor upwards have been recently refurbished. Locaion is away from main roads, and close to the no.19 tram, which takes you to the Vatican, or the no.3 bus, which takes you to the Colosseum-for 1 euro! 10/15 min. walk to the centre of town, but downhill, so use the tram/bus to get back. Staff very friendly. Substantial breakfast buffet. I hope you have as good a time in Rome as we had!

Reviews.Title: “three star hotel”
Reviews.Author: xania_10
Reviews.Content: Well Albani hotel is more like a three star rather than four star hotel. We arrived at the hotel and the reception told us that the hotel was overbooked and they sent us to Beverly Hills hotel, which was a fantastic hotel. Next day we went for sightseing in the city, we went back to the hotel at 10 in the night. The reception told us that we have to go back to Albani for the other four nights. Arriving in Albani the lady in the reception told to us that they apologised about the confusion. Never mind the hotel was basic but definatelly not a four star. The breakfast was good and the hotel clean. By the way i stayed there four nights and i asked to see the manager every day and all of them he was missing. I don't know what that means.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location-Thin Walls”
Reviews.Author: damooman
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a good location, away from the noise of the city centre but well connected by bus. The rooms were very clean but the walls were like paper, we could hear every move made in the neighbouring rooms. We were also awoken early one morning by a strange American man who convinced the staff that we had locked him out of his room. WiFi is not free as advertised and takes a long time to get set up.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but!”
Reviews.Author: trippingstu
Reviews.Content: Hotel was a little out of the way and had to use the complex Rome bus system or cabs to get around. Was in a very nice residential neighborhood with many nice restaurants. Buffet breakfast was average. The worst part of the stay was the bed, while the room was large, the bed was like sleeping on the floor.

Reviews.Title: “VERY NICE BUT....”
Reviews.Author: pralik
Reviews.Content: I stayed in Albani hotel for a night during a business travel. I liked the modern decoration. My room had very nice view to the forest, and a nice balcony in which even beginning of December you could enjoy your coffee. The decoration is brilliant, i like those modern rooms with bright colours (orange-green). Very spacious room, double (x large) confortable bed. The room had a Flat tv but i didnt manage to find any english channels. The room was very clean so the bathroom. I think the site advertised that sleepers were offered and I relied ending up to take showers and step into the floor without shoes. Also, there werent any mirors in the rooms accept the one in the sink and one behind Bathroom's doors, that seemed very uncovenient. The stuff was very friendly but they didnt all of them speak English but at least they were trying to communicate with you. Breakfast was average i have eaten better even in cheaper 4-5 star hotels. Wi FI internet some times was very slow you couldnt even log out in order not to loose your prepaied time. Nice hotel, far from sightseeings thought. Perfect if you are on a business trip visiting neighbouring companies.

Reviews.Title: “A quiet spot away from the hustle and bustle in Rome”
Reviews.Author: Northern-Travler
Reviews.Content: Hotel Albani Roma was a very nice, clean, comfortable hotel north of the busy center of Rome. It's in a quiet neighborhood about 4 blocks from the Villa Borghese. It is not close walking distance to many other major attractions. But several sites are just a short taxi ride. We were about a 15 to 20 minute taxi ride to the Vatican in busy traffic and a bit less to the center of old Rome. The Hotel is located on a narrow side street, so it’s very quiet. We were able to sleep with our balcony door open without being bothered by the noises of a busy city. The hotel is nicely appointed with a definite modern theme. The staff was courteous and polite. They were more than will to answer our questions and give us advice. It really helped that most spoke English. The rooms were also decorated in a modern theme. Ours had a strange curved open rod instead of a closet to hang clothes. It worked fine for us, but it was different. The bathroom was large, modern and clean. It took a minute or so to figure out how the flush worked, but that’s just because they do some things different in Europe. The breakfast was included with our room. The buffet was very well appointed, with plenty of choices including pastries, fruit, yogurt, meats (warm and cold), scrambled eggs, cereals, breads, and cheeses. It is in the basement level of the hotel, but it was bright and well lit including light from a skylight. It is close to some excellent local restaurants where we had very good meals at reasonable prices. There is nothing better than having authentic Italian pasta dishes at a local restaurant in Rome! Our hotel was part of a cruise package with Carnival. There was a representative from the cruise line available during the day to coordinate tours, answer questions, and coordinate transportation to the ship. I must say our stay at Hotel Albani was pleasant, quiet, and enjoyable. It’s not the place to stay if you want to be in the center of activity in Rome. But if you’re looking for that modern but quiet spot away from the hustle and bustle, this might be one hotel to consider.

Reviews.Title: “Nice”
Reviews.Author: riverbum123
Reviews.Content: The Albani Hotel is located off the main thoroughfares of the city. About two blocks. The streets are so narrow and tight that the tour buses couldn't get close. We would have to walk the two blocks or so to get to the hotel. Other than that, the hotel is quite comfortable and the staff is very professional and alway willing to help in anyway they can. The rooms were nice, clean and just roomy enough. Nice big bathroom. The view out the window was of the street and a brick wall across from the hotel. here are not convienient resturants

Reviews.Title: “Hard to sum up.”
Reviews.Author: Roddersf1
Reviews.Content: Where to start. The hotel location itself is far from ideal. No close Metro stop, However Bus routes were very frequent. The area in which the hotel is situated is outside the main tourist stops which has both good & bad points. The hotel building is very clean and plush. Very colourful and refreshing interior design. Breakfast buffet was excellent for both choice and quality with very friendly waiting staff. In stark contrast the reception and ground floor staff were some of the rudest I have ever encountered. As a frequent visitor to Europe only in Prague have I ever experienced the abruptness and sheer unhelpfulness of the staff. I cant stress enough the level on which I feel this ruined another wise very enjoyable stay at both the hotel and Rome itself. The rooms were small but you could live with this as they were very clean and of a very high standard. Would I stay at this hotel again? Probably not. I would stay more central and hope that the staff could crack a smile. To sum up its a business hotel so its not the cheapest room in Rome but they still have no interest in the tourist market.

Reviews.Title: “why is everybody so difficult to please!”
Reviews.Author: principessa43
Reviews.Content: Hotel Albani is an excellent, well run clean hotel. The location is only difficult if you cannot think beyond the square. How many of you who wrote reviews actually live close to your own town's attractions? Is 15 minutes such a long time to travel to see the wonders of the world? Get real here. The Albani is great value and the location is quite acceptable. And as the smart reviewers mentioned, you can actually feel like a local as the neighbourhood is a real Roman one, without a seething mass of ugly tourists at every turn.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, rude staff”
Reviews.Author: MarioeGabriela
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Albani for 3 nights in July and the room is very good, the breakfast is excellent but some members on the staff are rude, even we speaking in italian, only the guy at the lobby, during the morning, was friendly. The internet access had problems too.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely terrible experience, avoid!”
Reviews.Author: appreciaters
Reviews.Content: We recently traveled 3 weeks in Europe staying in nine hotels. Without exception this was our worst experience. First, when we checked in they charged us an additional 40 Euros because we had three people. In fact, they wanted us to purchase an additional room at first. I was traveling with two young teenage children. I certainly wouldn't leave them in their own hotel room in Rome! Second, when I checked out, they insisted I had not paid for the room even though I had my prepaid receipt printed off the internet. They wanted me to leave a blank credit card voucher in case in double checking their records they found they needed to charge my credit card. Plus, they were located far away from the major siteseeing locations and didn't provide any directions about bus routes, access to public transportation options etc that could help us. The staff was rude and of no help. I would avoid this hotel completely. The facility itself is nice and the breakfast staff was charming. Too bad they don't run the hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but hard to get to by bus”
Reviews.Author: rocketdude27
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a dense urban area of Rome. Our tour bus could only park about a block away from the hotel because of the tight corners and streets. Other than that the rooms were very nice, food was good, bar was very nice and service good.

Reviews.Title: “You could pay more but get less -be prepared to walk or use the Public Transport”
Reviews.Author: gseire123
Reviews.Content: This is a difficult hotel to describe. First of all in my opinion the rooms, lobby and all round appearance of the hotel are definately 3 star. The room we had was very nice but had no mini bar and the TV was a very small portable TV with few channels or movie options. The staff were OK - the bar man (Im pretty sure there was only 1) was very nice but without a word of English (it is in Rome and I dont have a word of Italian so who can complain?). Although calling the very limited drinks area just of the lobby a bar may be a streatch. Room service was also provided by this bar man - it consists of lasagne, Pizza and Cheese Burgers if I remember correctly. And they had a distinctly mircowaved taste from them. The room was funky and by big European city standards very big. I thought the decor was great and the entire hotel was SPOTLESS. The location was a little too far out of the way although the Zoo and a beautiful park and gardens are near by. The Vatican is miles away (take metro) and the Trevi fountain and the Collesseo are also a good 25 minute walk assuming you know where you are going (again you can take the metro). However, and this is where it becomes difficult to knock this hotel, if you are fully mobile the walks into the main tourist area are actually very enjoyable (not at the peak of the sunshine hours though - its just too hot). You get to see magnificant ruines of ancient structures that go by hardly noticed, you pass great coffee shops/bars and restaraunts that offer great food and really fantastic prices. Which for me gave a taste of the real Rome - out of the rip off central locations which are surrounded by tac. The Hotel is overpriced for what it is - we payed 110Euro a night. There are a huge number of OAP tours passing through the hotel - particularly from the USA which might explain the overpriced rooms so as to allow for inflaited package prices. Not sure about this hotel - hopefully you can make a call on it yourself from this review.

Reviews.Title: “Well designed hotel”
Reviews.Author: Weyland
Reviews.Content: We were here with a Globus Tour and found the hotel to be very modern in design, clean and elegant. The staff was helpful. I do wish I had read the previous review about them not mailing post cards...I gave them some to mail (they were stamped) so hopefully they will arrive... Breakfast was generally good with many options. Like the other hotels we stayed in in Italy, their scrambled eggs were not very good and even though we were the first in for breakfast, were less than lukewarm, not good. Stay with the hard boiled eggs. You do have to walk a ways to find restaurants and food stores but there is a pastry shop with wifi a block away. After our tour ended one day we stayed in town and use bus 63 to get back, just be sure to ask the hotel staff to tell you where to get off on the way back.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel, but a bit far from the sights”
Reviews.Author: brooklahn
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Albani was the second stop on my honeymoon in July 08. Overall, we were very pleased with the hotel - the decor was fun and bright, the rooms were immaculate and comfortable and the hotel bar was fun and comfortable. If there was a negative to the hotel, it was its distance from the main sites of Rome. It was a pretty significant walk to get to anything... about 30 minutes to the Spanish Steps, for instance. My wife and I didn't mind - just used public transportation a lot, and got to walk around the city a lot, which I find helps you really get to know a city. Might not be a good choice for older visitors or families with children, who don't want to have to expend so much effort navigating around the city. Overall, the hotel is definitely recommended. We'd stay there again in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: WilliamDachris
Reviews.Content: Great location and excellent hotel! The view of the balcony was great and the room was very large with a great bathroom. The breakfast was good but not excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Simply excellent”
Reviews.Author: Mythosyk
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a week's holiday in Rome. We stayed at the Albani hotel. It is simply an excellent hotel. The staff were very polite and spoke good english. Our room was beautifully decorated and furnished with bright cheerful colours. Everything was tastefully selected and matched. Breakfast was very good although the selection was not huge and you get a fresh tablecloth every time! Access to town was very easy with a bus stop nearby (50 metres). We used buses 86, 92 and 217 to go to Termini station. At the end of our stay we discovered bus 63 which takes you directly to the old town (Pantheon, fontana di Trevi etc) really handy. We recommend using a pass which enables you to use all buses, metro and overland trains within Rome very cheaply. For one day it is 4 euro and for 3 days it is 11 euro!! Dont bother with organised tours. Get a bus pass and a good map and ROme is at your feet. With the pass you can go even to the seaside, Ostia (which is beautiful) and more.

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay at Albani”
Reviews.Author: MileMarkerMike
Reviews.Content: My wife and I recently stayed at Hotel Albani for 2 nights as a result of joining relatives who were there with one of several Globus tours. We found the hotel to be clean and nicely appointed. The decor is 50's-60's retro style and while we liked it and thought it was fun, the bright colors and furnishings might not be to everyone's taste. The staff was helpful and of course spoke excellent English. Our room was also clean, medium sized, and nicely appointed but in this retro style. We had a small balcony that overlooked a beautiful park so we kept the glass doors open whenever we were in the room. Definitely a nice feature. The morning of our departure we ate breakfast on the balcony while watching a beautiful sunrise. An adequete breakfast was included and although the hotel is not close to major attractions in Rome, the front desk was prompt in providing directions or a taxi. Earlier in the week we stayed in a Marriott on the Via Venito. That experience was much nicer but it was also twice to three times the cost of Albani. While there are many hotels to choose from in Rome, we found Albani to be very nice and would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Good and Awful at the same time”
Reviews.Author: LikeitNice
Reviews.Content: Overall a very clean hotel but getting a little worn around the edges and using bright colours to hide a 70's decor. Its miles from anything but the Borghese Gallery (a must see!), especially food although we managed to find a couple of restaurants (I'll review in restaurant section); a problem as they dont serve dinner except to tours. Count on a good 30-45 minute walk to central sights (I am a fit walker who normally runs 6kms a day). (A round walking trip from the Albani to the Colosseum, across to Trastevere and back by the river past the Vatican is about 18km by the pedometer) Biggest disaster is the bus/cruise tour groups that the hotel is mainly for. No noise control as the big groups congregate in eachothers rooms, no space at breakfast, queuing at reception to do anything including picking up your key. Big room but the smallest tv in the world (luckily not what i came to Rome for) Not particularly friendly staff but put this down to the impersonal dealings on a constant basis with the tour groups

Reviews.Title: “GREAT STAY!!”
Reviews.Author: novmeister
Reviews.Content: My wife and i just came back from a ten day vacation in Italy, five days being in Rome. (it could be we were there a drop too long.) We had a flight and hotel package with the Albani hotel. It was a beautiful hotel! Nice lobby and bar. The reception was very helpful all through the trip. On the downside you have to pay for the internet and the location is definitely not central (although there are many buses that run right across the street from the hotel very often [1 euro one trip, 4euro one day, 16 euro 3 days]). The room was very spacious the food was very good (breakfast till 10:30!!) . About Rome; you should definitely get tours for vatican and collisium if you don't you can just buy tickets down the street [right by the arch of constantine] for the collisium by the forum entrance with no line at all (instead of one and a half hours). The forum is really cool also but for that you need a tour or else it's just a bunch of ruins. Night tours are generally the same route and if you can follow a map then you can really do it yourself. I would definitely stay there again in a trip back to Rome!!

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: ljl52477
Reviews.Content: Hotel Albani is a very good hotel, are room was huge with a very large balconey. The room was very clean and up to date. Nice flat screen TV at the foot of the bed! the bed was also very comfey. The staff was very helpfull in giving us directions and making us reservations at the colossium and borghesse museum. The only down side is it is a little far from the attractions (except the borghesse museum) but it is very close to the bus stop and trolly stop where you can easily get anywhere. The breakfast they serve in the morning is also pretty good, they had eggs and bacon that didn't look that appitizing but everything is else is just fine. All in all a good hotel, made us feel very comfertable.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: lalala34
Reviews.Content: My stay at the hotel albani was exceptional! Great everything! We had a large room with a large wrap around balcony, a flat screen tv, 2 large beds and a dinging area. It was spacious, clean, modern and cute. It was one of the best hotels i ever stayed at and boy did those a/c's work! And the breakfast was excellant! stay here!!!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely!”
Reviews.Author: valics
Reviews.Content: Hotel Albani is a lovely hotel and while is note really central it is only about one hour walk from Fontana di Trevi and it is very close to Galleria Borghese and Piazza Fiume (where all cheap eateries/ trattorias frequented by locals are). The area is very quiet and there are small supermarkets just around the corner(the receptionists can guide you which street to take). We especially were satisfied with the room because of the lively colours, very-very comfortable bed, plenty of space, massive furniture and (maybe only in our case in the first floor) the bathroom was also usable by visitors with disabilities. Whilst we did not use the minibar, it is worth to read the notice on its door stating: this minibar is fully computerised and any item removed from the shelves gets directly charged to the room account!!! Staff very helpful and friendly, we had a very decent breakfast and great coffee in the ungerground restaurant. Overall - great experience.

Reviews.Title: “Very Pleasant Stay!”
Reviews.Author: Sassy77Cat
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 nights at this hotel - 2 adults and 2 teenagers. Our room was very comfortable, king for the parents and roll aways for the kids. The bed was very, very comfortable! The bathroom was modern and very pleasant. Our room was spacious and did not feel crowded for 4 people sharing. The hotel was very quiet at night - an occasional car or truck outside but the windows are so sound proofed that it was not at all disturbing. The breakfast was very nice and the staff was extremely attentive. I agree the only downside was location, but once we learned our way around walking ( our preferred mode of transport) was easy or else there are bus lines very close that go to all parts of the city. A great experience - I would recommend to anyone! In fact I would love to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Albani - A positive experience”
Reviews.Author: JUGL11
Reviews.Content: Just got back from 3 nights at Hotel Albani in Rome. It's a cute little place, very clean & attractive with decent sized rooms. Breakfast is good, especially the sweet pastries. Staff is excellent, very friendly & helpful. The only negative comment I can make is that it isn't exactly centrally located. But there's a bus stop nearby (purchase tickets before boarding) & we learned that the 63 bus got us where we wanted to be. The front desk recommended Trattoria La Balestra for dinner, & booked us a table. That was good, because people without reservations were being turned away. La Balestra is just a 2 block stroll from the hotel. We were very pleased with our meal there.

Reviews.Title: “We loved this hotel”
Reviews.Author: adventurer1218
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Albani over the Christmas holiday and had a fabulous stay. We had a suite and there was 3 of us. We were perfectly comfortable and we loved the contemporary, funky look of the hotel. We would stay there again. The hotel is a little bit of a walk from the city center but we enjoyed the location, the hotel and the ambiance. Breakfast is offered every day and the staff was helpful and efficient. The hotel is not as noisy as staying in the heart of the city, and it is close enough that all of the tour companies will come to pick you up. We would highly recommend this hotel to everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Crisp and Quality”
Reviews.Author: Droitwich247
Reviews.Content: Booked this as part of a package through Easyjet (Easy Holidays). As described on their website it is not in the centre of Rome, but a little way out. The evening scene is not busy, but there are several restaurants in very easy walking distance. The hotel itself is clean and friendly. The room we had was on 6th floor (top) with a balcony overlooking a little park next to it. The balcony was not overlooked at all. A clean and well appointed bathroom (bath, shower, toilet, bidet, sink, huge mirror and hair dryer) was tiled all over. The main room had a small mini bar, plenty of controllable lighting and an acceptable (if not overly squidgy) double bed. The fitted cupboards had a small portable TV with english news and movie channels. As has been mentioned the colours are not muted but not over the top. Overall we were more than happy with the room. Daily maid service readied it for our return as you would expect. The restaurant where our included breakfast was served had plenty of attentive staff and was served 0630 to 10am. It had the usual cereals, orange and grapefruit juice, croissant, bread rolls, a couple of meats and cheeese etc. The only hot was scrambled egg and bacon, with hard boiled eggs also to hand. Unless you are overly fussy this usual continental fayre is perfect to set you up for the day. Have no problems reccommending this to others. If you are of average fitness, as we are, all Romes sights are accessible on foot from here. We did Vatican, Pantheon, Trevi Fountain, Piazza del Poppollo and Borghese Park in one circular trip from hotel of about 7 hours (8 miles walking). The next day we did ancient city, Coloseum, Spanish Steps, Trevi Fountain (again for ice cream!) and shopping in 6 hours (about 7 miles). Although we knew we had walked for two days by our sore feet we are not "hikers" by any description.

Reviews.Title: “excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: dalis70
Reviews.Content: the albani hotel is excellent. it has a free private parking, very good breakfast and a stunning view from the rooms. The rooms itself are decorated according to 70 style, with bright color from green to pink. During our stay we were really impressed by the cleaning room we had . The reception desk is very polite and helpful. the hotel is located in a very safe area of Rome. This is my third times I have gone to the albani hotel and I am going to go back again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel... but far from everything!!”
Reviews.Author: SinD1025
Reviews.Content: After having our original hotel canceled by no fault of our own or the previous hotels fault... we were quickly booked into Hotel Alabni. After the horrible hotel we had in florence this was definetly a better stay. Actually the BEST hotel we stayed at on our trip. The hotel is nice, a little more on the modern side and the front desk is very nice. This hotel is generally used for big groups. Our room was immaculate and beds very comfortable. Breakfast.. WOW!! It was great!! They served everything... and you had your own table.. and waiter! I have to say the ONLY downside to this hotel is the location. it's NOT centrally located and you have to grab a bus to go anywhere. The only thing close to this hotel is Galeria Borghese which was a couple blocks away. They have yummy little restuarants and bakerys around as long as you're willing to walk around and venture a little bit.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: KatyaL
Reviews.Content: Beautiful and very clean. We had a very spacious room and a gorgeous bathroom with toiletries of very good quality. The maid was cleaning our room very thoroughly. Our room was on the last, 7th floor. It had an automatically closing and opening skylight! It looks like the hotel is either new or was recently renovated, everything looks and smells new. The breakfast was ok in terms of variety (a fairly frequent problem in Italy), but the breakfast hall is beautiful and once again very clean. The reception staff is very helpful. You will not regret staying in this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Unique & Posh!”
Reviews.Author: Art4Kentucky
Reviews.Content: We had reservations through Travelocity at another hotel---unfortunately they were overbooked, but graciously booked the Hotel Albani for us and paid for the cab ride. We were really pleased with the unique decor, the somewhat off the beaten (tourist) path, and the service. We'll seek out the Hotel Albani next time we're in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “average hotel”
Reviews.Author: dhsi
Reviews.Content: Relatively cheaper hotel due to its location. not very convenient for tourist. taxi ride to town is about 6 euro, public transportaion is available but need walking. Hotel is clean and fairly contemporary. Lights in room are too bright with no adjustment for dime setting. Sound insulation is quite poor, can hear people talking in the aisle or next room. Service is acceptable with minimal staffing level. Breakfast is ok but no fresh omelete/egg service. Lounge cafe has no selection of food, just pizza and (microwave?) sandwich.

Reviews.Title: “Far from the madding crowd (except in the lobby at 7am!)”
Reviews.Author: reviewer76
Reviews.Content: I liked this hotel. It only takes the briefest of research to establish that it isn’t right in the middle of Rome’s tourist attractions, so I think those who have criticized the hotel for this should have been well aware of this in advance. The advantage of this location is the wonderful peace and quiet that can be enjoyed sitting on your balcony, with the rest of Rome only a 15 minute walk away. I was very glad not be staying more centrally with the incessant moped buzz that goes on in that part of town. Taxis in Rome are also reasonable if you get tired of walking, and the reception desk will call them for you for pick up right at the door. The accommodation was quite basic, but very funky and very different to most other hotels I have stayed before. After years of chain hotels that all look the same, this was refreshing and it will be an easy place to remember because of it. The continental breakfast buffet was a great way to start a day of sightseeing. The Scandinavian bistro across the road is also terrific value compared to lesser establishments in the centre of town and has a lovely atmosphere. The hotel is used quite heavily by American tour companies (which may put some people off!) who start their excursions early morning. There is an early morning rush that seems to be before the tours depart, so if you are not on a tour, don’t get up too early and you’ll miss the crush at the buffet and the lobby.

Reviews.Title: “Overall poor experience”
Reviews.Author: mac34
Reviews.Content: This hotel was selected by our tour company, but we elected to go in a day early. It was not worth the price. As some have noted, it is very poorly situated, even for the tour company's bus (bus had to park four blocks away). It is convenient, walking distance, to the Borghese. It is quiet. There was a sewer gas smell in our room that they could not fix in three days. Front desk service was limited and snobbish. They had no information abouit the bus service except where the bus stop was located. There's no restaurant in the hotel, but I have to say that at least one of the restaurants in the neighborhood recommended by the hotel was outstanding

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel but at the end of the world”
Reviews.Author: ruchichheda
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Albani hotel in Rome for 3nights. As such there is no problem with the hotel. Rooms are very colorful...Orange / pink / cream.....;) but the hotel is very far from the main attractions like Spanish Steps & Trevi fountains. Overall it was ok if you ready to take a bus or a taxi to get to some good restaurants or to go for shopping

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: nicolacoast
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Albani for 6 days midway through January. We saw the crazy colour scheme and loved it. As for the frosty staff we never saw any, they were all very pleasant and more than happy to help with any requests. It is a bit away from the centre, and it takes 15mins to walk to spanish steps tube exit at villa borghese. We would recommend it to anyone who doesnt mind walking a bit and if your going to rome your going to have to like walking.

Reviews.Title: “Hope you like walking!!!!”
Reviews.Author: a_dream_away
Reviews.Content: We decided to book this hotel on the recommendation of the travel agent who said that it was a 10 minute walk from the spanish steps, but it took us more like 45 - 50 minutes to walk to the spanish steps or any of the sights. I agree with some of the other reviews, the reception staff were very frosty and we got the same reaction with regards to any bars or restaurants in the area. I think the reception staff must be getting some form of commission cause they kept asking us if we had been to the recommended restaurant. The rooms were clean and very well looked after. But I was very suprised that a 4 star hotel did not have a room service facility or any tea and coffee making facilities in the room. If this hotel was more centrally located then it would be ideal. The price is reasonable and the rooms were well kept.

Reviews.Title: “Nice and clean business hotel”
Reviews.Author: dav4844
Reviews.Content: The hotel was clean with multi-colored bed and bathrooms and is located in a residential neighborhood. The staff was helpfull and breakfast was good with offerings of multiple choices. The hotel is a bit out of the way but it was very quiet at night. Would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “A Proper Four Star (By Rome Standards)”
Reviews.Author: kevinos1
Reviews.Content: When i saw this hotel online, i instantly thought, NO!no way was i staying in a place with a colour scheme like that, it looked awful!but as things usually go i was constrained by budget and time and booked it anyway,sure that i had made a big mistake! well there was no mistake!!on entering the hotel, the reception is area is large enough, the first thing that hits you is of course its vibrant colours but the second thing that strikes you is how immaculate everything is!check in was easy, the usual no italian nicities that well, if youve been to italy more than once youve come not to expect. however over our stay the staff were efficient and well i have no criticims of them whatsoever. on entering the room i did what i think everyone does when they realize theyve picked a winner...a sigh of relief!!!the colour scheme wasnt off putting at all..in fact it brightened up our stay..we stayed in a drab hotel last year and it wasnt a great feeling having to go back to the "dungeon" at night.. the room was spotless..quite big but not huge,the bed however was huge and took up most of the room..a good trade off if you ask me?!the bathroom was large enough..bigger than most ive stayed in! the room was cleaned daily, on our first day we left the room in a bad state (we were rushing for the eurostar) the staff had picked up all our clothes,folded them and arranged all of our stuff around the room neatly..to the point of putting our pj's folded on our pillow..now thats service!!the room is refilled everyday with plenty of toiletries..from pure vegtable soap to cotton buds! the hotel itself is a twenty minute walk from piazza bernini along the via veneto..our a 8 minute taxi ride (yes i timed it)..not central if u like to stay next to the monuments etc but central if u like seeing the real city ur staying in!! all in all..stay here for one of the better hotels in rome!!

Reviews.Title: “A pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: cbkingery
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Hotel Albani for two nights during our Globus tour. I enjoyed the art deco feel of the hotel, with our magenta carpet and black marble bathroom and shiny veneered wood paneled walls. Our room was clean, although it didn't look as if the bathroom floor had been mopped. There was no air conditioning but we were able to open the windows and then close the outside shutters for privacy. The lighting was dimmer than we're used to but the mirrored walls behind the bed reflected the light. The buffet breakfast provided was good and the service we encountered was pleasant. In sum, I really don't have anything negative to say about the Albani. I wished it was more centrally located to the historic part of town because it was quite a walk to get back and forth. For this reason only, I probably woudln't stay at the Albani. If it was moved closer downtown, I might.

Reviews.Title: “Great value choice”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: After searching for ages for a hotel in Rome I chose the Albani based on the reviews on this site and the fact that it was very good value. The Hotel was clean & contemporary and the staff very friendly & helpful. Breakfast was standard continental and fine for what we required. Although slightly out of the city centre, Albani can be reached by bus no's 86 or 92 from Termini -however we tended to walk mostly which meant that we got to see more of the city. There are some very good restaurants in the vicinity (one of which was recommended by the hotel), not full of tourists and fantastic prices. I would definitely recommend this hotel if you don't mind not having everything on your doorstep and I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Highs and lows”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The hotel was modern and comfortable but some of the finishings were a bit tatty. Contrary to its website, the hotel did not have a florist. However, the bar was good (but underused by guests) and the restaurant was nice. Breakfast was continental and the selection never changed so it got a bit boring after 5 nights. The Albani was slightly out of the centre and initially difficult to find. However, we liked the residential location and felt we experienced a bit of real Rome. Neighbouring bars and restaurants were not at all touristy and great value.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Lisazona
Reviews.Content: This Hotel was just fine. The glass and steel exterior looked a little "cyborg-ish" as was the ultra "mod" a la late 60's decor -- Italian style of course. Our Room was pink and green, spacious and clean. Nice, quiet part of Rome. Service was courteous, helpful. The breakfast was OK but the service was very good. The only downside was the coffee. I suggest asking the staff for a cappucino at no extra charge. The clientele seemed to be mostly business people and seniors from all over the world.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant & friendly”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel in a quiet area of the city which allows for a decent nights sleep away from all the noise in Rome. Staff where very pleasant and helpful and the rooms where very spacious and cleaned daily. The hotel is obviously being upgraded room by room but although there was work going on a couple of doors down from us we never heard a thing. My only concerns/comments would be that the resturant wasn't open for dinner when we stayed there and I don't know if this was because it was early March or if it doesn't open. Also there were no tea or coffee facilities in the rooms (again I've heard that this is the norm in Rome) but it would have been a nice touch for a hotel advertising itself as 4*. It is a nice hotel but I would only rate it 3* because of these two things. I would recommend the hotel if you like a bit of a walk and don't want to be in the centre. With no resturant it was about a 20 minute walk to the nearest resturants at night which had people in them! Bus stop was at the end of the street but we couldn't work out where to buy tickets so just walked everywhere but again the metro stop is about 20 mins walk away for all the major sites.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed in hotel Albani in Rome for 7 days with my husband. We chose hotel Albani, after looking at the recommendations in Tripadvisor. The hotel is situated in a nice and quiet residential area. We received a large and spacious room, with a big bathroom. The hotel is very clean and everything is shining. The staff is polite and helpful (most of them speak English). One of the workers even checked the weather for me in the Internet every day. They serve a good breakfast, and you can eat as much as you like. The hotel is not in the center of Rome, but the bus station is about 2 minutes walk, and there are buses running every several minutes to Termini station and to other places. For one Euro you can travel in any line for 75 minutes, change buses and travel in the Metro with the same ticket. It is a nice area with many small shops all around, and the beautiful Villa Borghese is less than 5 minutes walk. I recommend this hotel and will certainly stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “a wonderfull time at Hotel Albani”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We had a fantastic time at the Albani's hotel. The hotel was very clean, modern and quiet, the breakfast was plenty and delicious, the beds and room were very clean and the best of all, the bathroom, wide and very modern. We really recomend Albani as a perfect point to stay in Rome. At the street behind the hotel there are 3 o 4 lines of buses conecting with termini metro station and from there Rome is at yor feet. To come back there are some buses that leave you at only five minutes walk from the Hotel, a very nice and quiet walk as the sorroundings of the hotel are very nice. If we come back to Rome we are going to stay again at the Hotel Albani. One tip: when you arrive to Rome buy a 3 days ticket (bus and metro) to save you money and time moving around, you can buy it at the machines at the metro.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, but too far away...”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Albani Hotel was included in our recent Globus tour of Italy. We arrived in Italy a few days early, and booked our own hotel in the center of the historic area. After a few days of having everything within a short walk, the Albani's location seemed like the boonies! Don't get me wrong, the rooms are spacious and nicely furnished and have every comfort you could wish for (although the colour scheme of hot pink and lime green remains an acquired taste...)but it is simply too far away to be convenient. Who wants to spend their time in Rome navigating public transport? The staff are very helpful and attentive, but they cannot make up for being in the suburbs. At night, the neighborhood is a ghost town. Do yourself a favour, spend a little more and book something in the center of the city and walk, walk, walk. Taxi's in Rome are very expensive, so stay away unless you have no other option.

Reviews.Title: “Albani was good”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Albani hotel with a Globus tour. Hotel and rooms were clean and comfortable. I would stay here again. Offered internet access on a nice computer in the lobby. Staff were helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed the Albani and Neighborhood”
Reviews.Author: bob ashdown
Reviews.Content: Spent three nights at the Albani via Globus tour. The rooms were clean and comfortable with large bathrooms. Breakfast is traditional continental plus scrambled eggs and bacon. Map of Rome available at the desk. Neat neighborhood with plenty of local shops and restaurants as well as an outdoor market. Suggest that you walk around the neighborhood if you get a chance. Sampled the pastry shop at the Via Po corner as well as a nearby bar to pick up beer and soft drinks which we took back to our room and a local pizza place -- ate excellent pizza standing up like the locals. We exchanged money at a bank a couple of blocks from the hotel. Everyone was helpful and friendly, despite the language differences. It is a walk to the attractions, but shorter than the walks we took on our tours. Highly recommend the Albani if you don't mind walking a bit and want to enjoy a local neighborhood.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and contemporary”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We have just got back from Albani and thought it was lovely. Before booking we were concerned that it would be too far out of the centre but we were pleased that we didn't stay near Termini station as it was not a nice area. Albani is set in a quiet and clean area with traditional restaurants and Italian delis nearby. Busses to and from Termini (86, 92) are frequent and easy to use. The hotel is clean and very comfortable with simple and modern decoration. Staff were helpful, especially in recommending places to eat. If you are looking for a quieter, less touristy area of Rome this is great. It is not tacky or overpriced and is friendly and easy to get around.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Rooms, Yummy Breakfast”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed here as part of a Globus tour, and it was the best hotel they put us in. The rooms are a nice sized and the bathrooms are large. The staff is friendly, and they have a large free breakfast with cream puffs, croissants, scrambled eggs, and bacon. The only drawback is the neighborhood. It is a bit of a walk from the main tourist attractions, and walking back at night was a little scary. During the day it was totally fine and there were lots of pizza parlors and restaurants to eat at. We took a cab to the tourist attractions in the morning (ranged from 6-8 euro) and made our way back by walking (about 20 minutes, depending where you go).

Reviews.Title: “They take away the AC in the middle of the night to save $”
Reviews.Author: JeanMiami
Reviews.Content: We stayed there 4 nights. On all 4 nights the AC was turned off at about 3 AM. I would wake up sweating and complain to the front desk. They would turn the air from the reception!!!! On the last night when I called at about 4 AM, they told me that they were going to send a techinician to fix it at 8 AM, an hour after I was supposed to have checked out. I dont know why but I suspect it was done on purpose to save money and expecting people would not get up.

Reviews.Title: “Albani is a nice place to stay”
