Reviews.Author: Persille
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Hotel Albani as part of a Globus tour of Italy. In every meaningful way, the hotel was just fine. The staff was nice, the room was clean, the breakfast was plentiful. The location was wonderfully quiet. We were lucky enough to have a room with a balcony that faced the wooded area next door. I can't comment on how convenient the hotel's location is because we were bussed to every tourist site. In small ways the hotel could be better. For example, the TV magazine in our room was out of date. The breakfast, while plentful, was pretty much the same as in other hotels. Nothing out of the ordinary. However, despite the small details, I would consider staying again at the Albani if it fit the needs of my next trip.

Reviews.Title: “fab hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just come back from a stay at the hotel albani do not have a bad to say for the place The staff are friendly and helpful rooms are bright and clean breakfast was excellent Not to far from the centre if you use the public transport which is cheap and very easy Good local resturants would definetly go back to stay there

Reviews.Title: “A pleasant surprise”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: A friend organised a birthday weekend in Rome for six of us, booking this hotel, and when I read the reviews on this site, my heart sank. However, I was pleasantly surprised. Our rooms and bathrooms were large and clean. The decor isn't retro - the 60s and 70s look is completely different from this - it's very distinctive, very Italian, very now and it works very well. If you're on a once-in-a-lifetime trip to Europe and only have a day or two in Rome, this isn't the hotel for you as it is too far from all the famous places you'll want to see. However, if you've been to Rome before, or have longer to spend there, this is a good choice. It's a nice area, the Borghese Park is lovely with three good museums in it, and the local bus to the central station is cheap and frequent. As for the staff, we didn't find them rude or unhelpful at all and they appreciated our (pretty poor) attempts at Italian. In fact, when we tottered in at four in the morning and I realised I'd left my favourite hat in the cab, Marco the night porter just asked which bar had called us the cab and ushered us off to bed promising that my hat would be at reception the next morning, which it was - when I asked whether I owed the driver anything for bringing it, they said it was all taken care of and not to worry.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful rooms in Albani”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We went to Albani Hotel on a group tour. The lobby was ok but a bit old fashioned, but the rooms were nice. Our first room was very old and small and far down a winding alley, but we asked for another and they gave us a newer, renovated one near the lift. Our parents had a large room which was new and extremely clean. I think many of the rooms have now been renovated, and are very pretty! The retro look is definitely in fashion in this hotel, which gives an interesting look. Yes- green carpet and pink beds with bright, flowery curtains. The most important thing was that it was very clean. I thought it a bit weird how each of the rooms were different sizes, for the same price. I agree- the receptionists were very rude, and treated the customers like we were pests and who needed to be ignored. They were willing to exchange our traverllers cheques however, for a 5% fee. However, ignore their attitude and you will love your rooms!

Reviews.Title: “Ironing is dangerous”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel over the weekend of the 12/02/05. As other reviewers have pointed out the decor is "interesting", you'll either love it or hate it. Personally I think it was fantastic, it's like being in an Austin Powers Movie. The room itself was fantastic, ours overlooked the nearby park and was completely private, south facing with a balcony, a great suntrap. The room was also spotless and the bathroom fitted to a very high standard. As others have commented the staff can appear to be rude or unhelpful, however try speaking abitofdalingo, it will get you further even if it's just hello and gooday etc. You're unable to do your own ironing at this hotel, it costs 3 euros a shirt, which whilst not expensive is an inconvenience. Don't ask for an iron you'll be told it's dangerous! So either pay the 3 euros, don't take shirts or just buy new ones when you're there. Also ask around for prices on an airport transfer from the hotel. Some dodgy italian man behind reception will offer you a limousine service for 50 euros (60 if it's early in the morning) We chose this option for convenience and were provided with a driver a realtively new mercedes...and what I can only guess was the drivers wife in the front seat, who snored continuously for the full journey. I guess it adds to the memories, but be warned ;-) As for location I have no complaints, you can walk to most places, however to rest your feet the local bus service is very good and will take you to the central station in about 10 minutes where you can get the metro to all the tourist sites. Other wise just take a stroll through Borghese Park down to Flaminio, it's not too far and very pleasant. I would consider staying at this hotel again, but I would go armed with a travel iron and would not take the "limosuine".

Reviews.Title: “Apalling service; completely disorganised; did not stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Booked by a colleague, we arrived 21 Oct 04 to be told they had no record of the booking, although we had it from the Telegraph agency. The receptionist was clueless and stated that they had no rooms and returned our credit cards. My colleague made new arrangements by phone with another hotel and asked for a letter stating that there were no rooms. Some time later, another "under-manager" appeared and said that they did have rooms! We replied that it was too late; we had had to make other arrangements. Another "under manager" said that we would have to pay! After waiting for the "manager" to appear (he never did) we left. We were being held as hostages to fortune; be warned and don't book there!
